module.name: dimension_tolerance
module.keywords: module, dimension, tolerance, angular, location, linear, plus, minus, limit, fit

abstract.li: specification of geometric dimensions of a feature of a shape;
dimensions that locate a feature relative to another feature;
specification of the value of a dimension;
dimensions that specify the size of a feature;
specification of tolerances for geometric dimensions;
plus and minus tolerances applied to dimensions;

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of geometric dimensions of a shape and the direct application of tolerances to geometric dimensions.

inscope.li: specification of geometric dimensions of a feature of a shape;
dimensions that locate a feature relative to another feature;
specification of the value of a dimension;
specification of tolerances for geometric dimensions;
plus and minus tolerances applied to dimensions;
items within the scope of application module Derived shape element, ISO/TS 10303-1130;
items within the scope of application module Document assignment, ISO/TS 10303-1122;
items within the scope of application module Extended measure representation, ISO/TS 10303-1106;
items within the scope of application module Value with unit extension, ISO/TS 10303-1753.

outscope.li: the presentation of dimensions and tolerances as annotations to the model or in a drawing.

aa.refpath: angular_location <= dimensional_location = dimensional_characteristic = dimensional_characteristic <- dimensional_characteristic_representation.dimension dimensional_characteristic_representation dimensional_characteristic_representation.representation -> shape_dimension_representation <= shape_representation <= representation representation.items[i] -> representation_item {representation_item.name = 'orientation'} representation_item => geometric_representation_item => placement => (axis2_placement_2d) (axis2_placement_3d)
